intro: Carduus antarcticus, commonly known as the Antarctic thistle, is a perennial plant native to the cold regions of the Southern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant thrives in harsh environments, such as rocky soils and alpine areas, due to its adaptability to low temperatures and high altitudes. Its leaves are covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss and protect against frost. The Antarctic thistle plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is an important component of its native ecosystem.
